page.title: 17THE VILLAGE COLLEGE
page.content: The village college is attended by nearly 1000 pupils ranging from 11 to 16 years. But, it is not just schoolchildren that use the college facilities, many other people from the community use it for a variety of things. For example: Squash, Tennis, Keep Fit, Typing, and evening classes for parents. The college was founded by Mr Henry Morris who, over sixty years ago was Chief Education Officer for Cambridgeshire. This year (1985) we celebrate our Silver Jubilee anniversary, and have been visited by the Duke of Edinburgh and Sir Keith Joseph who is the Secretary of Education. We have a star amoung us. Mr Wallin, a science teacher, appeared on the BBC's 'Beat the Teacher' quiz show, and is the Champion of Champions..!
